name: Check list Description: Stormwater Drainage Pipes Installation
ITP created by: Jon De Castro
ITP approved for use by: Aldrin Guinchoma
1. Pipes are set-out in accordance to IFC Drawings and Section 701.10 with the following tolerances below.
(a) offset of entry pits required to match lines of  kerbs or barriers ±20 mm
(b) plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers ±100 mm
(c) invert level of pipes at pits ±50 mm
(d) departure from design grade of pipe runs ±10 mm in 10 m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250
1. Excavation for pipe have a horizontal clearance between the pipe and the excavation wall as per below.
2. The base of the trench have been compacted to refusal using mechanical plant.
1. Bedding material provided and placed in the full width of the trench to the below minimum:
2. Bedding material placed and compacted in layers <150mm loose thickness
@Jesse - please check bedding requirements as per design (use sand bedding?)
1. Tested minimum of 20% of all lots for each culvert. (Lot = 1 layer of bedding).
2. Bedding compacted to refusal by hand held mechanical equipment & material (Swell ≥ 2.5%) mean moisture ratio of 92%  between the completion of rolling and the placement of overlaying laye.
Responsible Engineer to confirm if the bedding testing is required for this lot.
2. Pipes phycially checked and confirmed No Damage prior to install
3. Rebate and socket ends of pipe segments placed facing upstream and be fully engaged
4. Gaps between spigot and socket are in accordance with the manufacturers specifications
5. Lower portion of pipe in contact with the bedding layer and shaped to accomodate the joint collar
6. Correct type and size of rubber rings used and properly installed at pipe joints
6 - Pipes - Placement of Pipe - Flexible Pipe
2. Pipes phycially checked and confirmed No Damage prior to install
3. Rebate and socket ends of pipe segments placed facing upstream and be fully engaged
4. Gaps between spigot and socket are in accordance with the manufacturers specifications
5. Lower portion of pipe in contact with the bedding layer and shaped to accomodate the joint collar
6. Correct type and size of rubber rings used and properly installed at pipe joints
1. Lifting holes plugged off in accordance with the manufacturers specifications after the pipe is installed.
Each run of underground drainage shall be Survey verified prior to backfilling.
- Plan location pits not adjacent to kerb +/- 100mm
- Invert level of pipes at pits +/- 50mm
- Departure from design grade +/- 10mm in 10m, provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250
1. Correct type of Backfill material used.
2. Backfill material placed full width of bedding material and compacted in layers <150mm loose thickness.
3. Filling not placed within 2.0m of the open end of the pipe.
1. Tested minimum of 20% of all lots for each culvert. (Lot = 1 layer of bedding or backfill).
2. Backfill material compacted to a density ratio > 97%.
3. Material with ≥ 2.5% have been maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of overlaying layer.
REFERENCE: ITP-008-CIV-Stormwater Drainage Supply & Installation - Item 6.1
